paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: hATTR-PN with progressive gait disorder, hypoesthesia, and muscle weakness

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive gait disorder, hypoesthesia of both legs, muscle weakness
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with a distal, painful hypaesthesia of both legs, a cardiomyopathy, and a muscle weakness in the form of a girdle-type pattern of the arms and legs.

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive gait disorder due to distally stressed polyneuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: His 89-year-old mother also had a progressive gait disorder due to a distally stressed polyneuropathy of both legs starting at the age of 81 years.
His 55-year-old sister and his 65-year-old brother were not affected by a polyneuropathy.
His 55-year-old sister and his 65-year-old brother were not affected by a polyneuropathy.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with hATTR-PN and has been reported as clinically relevant.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, as the mother is affected and siblings are unaffected.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is annotated as pathogenic in ClinVar and HGMD.
key_quotes: These variants are annotated as pathogenic in ClinVar and HGMD and have been reported as clinically relevant in several unrelated individuals with hATTR-PN.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
